org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.stream

Interface CloseableIterator<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The element type which is returned by next().
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ObjectInput
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCloseableIterator, ConcatenatedCloseableIterator, TransformingCloseableIterator

    public interface CloseableIterator<T>
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A CloseableIterator is simply a regular Iterator that has to be closed explicitly.

    This class does not extend Iterator for a very good reason. Not implementing Iterator prevents assignment of an CloseableIterator instance to a Iterator variable. This would be dangerous, because the Iterator-typed variable may be passed on as a regular iterator to other code, and close() would never be invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • concat

        static <E> CloseableIterator<E> concat(java.util.Iterator<CloseableIterator<E>> iterators)
        Concatenates the two given iterators into one common iterator.

        Calling close() on the resulting iterator will close all of the "child" iterators. The iteration process itself is lazy: the first iterator will be fully consumed (and closed) before the second iterator is touched by next().

        Parameters:
        iterators - The iterators to concatenate. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The combined concatenated iterator. Never null.

      • transform

        static <E,F> CloseableIterator<F> transform(CloseableIterator<E> iterator,
                                            java.util.function.Function<? super E,? extends F> function)
        Transforms every element in the given iterator by applying the given function on it, resulting in a new iterator.

        The given function will be applied in a lazy way, i.e. values will be converted on the fly when they are requested via next().

        Closing the resulting iterator will also close the wrapped iterator.

        Parameters:
        iterator - The iterator to transform. Must not be null.
        function - The transformation function to apply to each element of the iterator. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The transformed iterator. Never null.

      • next

        T next()
        Same as the regular Iterator.next().
        Returns:
        The next element in this iterator. Depending on the implementation, this may be null.

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()
        Same as the regular Iterator.hasNext().
        Returns:
        true if there is another element to be returned in next(), otherwise false.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this iterator.

        Any further call to hasNext() will return false, and any further call to next() will fail with an exception.

        Closing a closeable iterator more than once is permitted, but has no effect.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Checks if this iterator has been closed.
        Returns:
        true if this iterator has already been closed, otherwise false.

      • forEachRemaining

        default void forEachRemaining(java.util.function.Consumer<T> action)
        Performs the given action for each remaining element in this iterator.

        /!\ This will NOT close this iterator! The iterator will still need to be closed manually afterwards.

        Parameters:
        action - The action to perform for each remaining element. Must not be null.

      • asIterator

        default java.util.Iterator<T> asIterator()
        Returns a plain Iterator representation of this closeable iterator.

        The returned iterator directly forwards calls to hasNext() and next() to their equivalents in this object. Therefore, advancing the returned iterator will also advance this closeable iterator.

        WARNING: Do not invoke this method unless for interoperability with Iterator-based APIs, because the information that this iterator needs to be closed will no longer be present in the returned iterator.

        Returns:
        A plain iterator representation of this closable iterator.
